Posts.Content:
i am so sorry Eimme! that is a truely genuine sorry. i am so newly diagnosed myself that I cant give you and advice or tips i feel so bad about
 that hun! All i can do is try to comfort you and be hear to listen to you. I see you say this happened after your Biopsy i had no idea that this could happen from a biopsy, apperently I didnt fully understand everything they were saying to me. I didnt have anything like that happen, althugh contrary to what they said it did hurt me a lot =(. the first needle was fine the second holy moly!! they should be grateful i let them do any more after that but they did and i got my results. I am having to wait to see my specialist, i get in on the 8th of this month I thank God for that, so i can relate to feeling like not doing anything to fight the cancer, that is a real sun of a gun and the helplessness and fear is incredible! Please come back and let me know how you are doing and vent or cry or sit in silence or have a happy moment our feelings are what they are and i can accept the good the bad and the ugly no problem, what ever you need to do I am here i check in every day that I am home, if i miss a day or something it is because i am seeing the Dr's, but i will be back =) Big hug
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Hi every one newly diagnosed Breast cancer ... what do i call my self person? lol To be brutaly honest i do not know anything about
 breast cancer other than it is the worst thing i probably ever faced in my life and believe me when i say i face a lot of worse things...
 I go see my specialist on the 8th of this month so will know more then. My diagnosis reads as this breast mass is suggestive of invasive ductal carcinoma and lymph nodes are positive for metastasis. you all probably know a heck of a lot more what that means than I do. 
oddly enough the thing that jumped out at me was this..we lose our eye lashes too?! I mean im no beauty queen so concite is far down the list of my personality but geez really! =( I am just trying to come to terms with losing a breast or both and the real possibility i might not make it although i am very optomistic that my fighting spirit and family and freinds old and new will pull me through. 
Like i said i dont know much and to be frankly honest im scared out of my mind to learn to much to fast =( even though time is really not on my side It takes a lot for me to process this at all. please bear with me. =( 
I apoligize if this is the wrong place to post this.
Posts.Title: Hair regrowth after Taxotere ?

Posts.Content:
Hey Deb, checking in. Feeling off kilter last couple of days, it is the oddest feeling, A mix of emotions all wrapped into one big ball, so If someone asked me how i was feeling i would have to answer honestly, which feeling do you want to know about
 lol. One Feeling i can unequivocaly say that is there is Gratitude, i am so grateful I'm not alone. That may sound selfish, but this is such a selfish disease! =( It takes so much and gives nothing back, I am just Grateful that there are women and men who are willing to give so much, so that the fact that this disease may take a lot from us, but there are women and men who are willing to give so much more. thank you every one and thank you Deb, your words mean a lot to me. Hugs for every one I have oddles of hugs to give away =).
Posts.Title: Mastectomy complications

Posts.Content: Understand it is a huge decision and I hope that you can find it in your heart and head to make the one that is best for you. Talk to your surgeon and ask him to give it to you straight and what he recommends and why one option is better than the other. Every situation is different, eventhough we all have the same disease, it is important to talk to your surgeon and ask for straight up facts, and what your chances are for reacurance with a lumpectomy versus a masectomy so you can make a informed decision. Hearing the facts can really be hard on us but we have the right and need to know the facts. Will be here for you no matter what, and yea this is a brutal disease on so many levels. Be gentle with your self, and know that what ever you feel, is ok. I too was told by my surgeon that the type of breast cancer i have has a high rate of recurrance, and it is already very advanced, however, I still have choices and options, and I hold those choices very near and dear, and make as informed ones as I can. My surgeon told me that it wont make a difference if I have a mast or a lumpectomy in my treatment, radiation and chemo will be the primary treatment for my cancer, so i opted for the lumpectomy, and lymph node removal as that I really had no choice in the lymph node removal, if i was doing what was best for me. If it comes back, the surgeon said it probably wont be in my breast but some were else in my body. for you hun though this is stuff you need to discuss thuoraly with your surgeon, as we all have different options, even though we all have the same disease. We disscussed it thouraly so I am confident I made the right decision for me, based on the facts. My other Dr, also concured that this is a good decision based on my facts, so am pretty optimistic eventhough the treatments are going to be very aggressive, will cross that bridge when i get to it =). Please keep in touch and feel free to write anything and everything, no judgement here =). No need to be sorry for how you feel, or if what you say does not make sense to others, cause Honestly we are all speaking the same language here and totally get what you are saying and even what you are not saying. It really a painful decision to have to make and come to a place of acceptance, that "yea I can live with this decision." keep in touch and im Rooting for you!! Hugs.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Hey Tammid, I already had my biopsy, I am going for the scan/ MRI and chest exrays on the 8th. this is to make a determination as to whether my cancer has spread from my lymph nodes to other parts of my body. You need the biopsy to determine whether there is cancer cells present, the MRI is to determine how far it has spread if at all. the MRI will also show any abnormalities present, so it is really a good idea to do both, as from what I understand is if they find cancer they are not always able to detect cancer cells that are present else were, thats why they do MRI. However, they havent confirmed you have cancer present in the breast so it is important to have the biopsy and get confirmation or woo hoo im healthy or the alternative which is you do have cancer and you are going to fight it and be healthy, happy and cancer free, positive thinking. The MRI is probably a percautionary procedure as they want to be sure they do all they can to come to a confirmative diagnosis of positive or negative. I didn't get schedualed for the scans till after my confirmation, but you may have a Dr that is very cautious and cares about
 you a lot so he wants to cover all the bases, I would put your faith in God of your understanding, your Dr and yourself =) and do biopsy and if they want a MRI i would do that too, and don't be afraid to ask them why they want to do it this way. I know it really hard to relax and wait the waiting is awful, and talk about
 yur fears and feelings it is ok to feel what ever you are feeling it is normal and it is normal to be scared. no matter what happens I will be around if you need some one to talk to or sit with you in those moments when the day aint so bright and the light at the end of the tunnel looks suspiciously like a train lol. We will have our moments many many moments in a day and they are all going to be diffrent some good some bad and some downright ugly, but im here to share them all with you if you need and want too =)
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content: hey Delta, so sorry to hear you are having pain =( Having an itch yu cant itch is maddening! I hear ya! If having another ultra sound would help assauge some of your fears there is no harm in doing so, im my opinion. But please do see the surgeon as well as he will be able to do a more thoural examination for you. It is my sincere hopes that you will be able to come to a solution on how to fix this problem in the best possible way for you =). As for knowing what is wrong I really can't say and i certainly don't know how to fix it im sorry. What I can do is support, encourage and lend a understading ear while you take your steps to come to a solution for this.
Posts.Title: having strange symptoms and need advice

Posts.Content:
Hey glad to her that you are getting things done the biopsy results prob vary in how long it takes to get results back depending were you are and how busy they are. It took me i would say about
 a week to get mine back, well just under a week. im holding on Tammid seems every time i turn around some one wants a peice of me. in pain so not very happy camper today and havent been able to eat all day so that prob does not help. Keep in touch always look forward to hearing from you all =)
Posts.Title: 2 Mammograms and an ultrasound later...?

Posts.Content:
Hey tammid, im really glad to hear your mammogram looks good this is a good thing! This is what i think is happening they are not sure what the spot is and the surgeon/specialist wants to take a closer look at it and make a confirmative diagnosis as to what it is. It is scary as heck i know, and it is really hard to deal with the what ifs and not freak out. The spot could be any number of things so they really need to take a closer look. they would not do anything drastic unless they know conclusivly that it is indeed Breast cancer and to do that they really need a sample of the spot/tissue.They would let you know if it was cancer and they knew that how could they with hold information like that from you? If they did I would be astounded. I have been newly diagnosed so I may not be much help, but the one thing I can do is understand what you are going through right now in this moment. no matter what see the dr and let me know how it goes ok and if you need to talk i will check in here as talking to you helps me too =D
Hugs

So I can imagin what it would be like to have that happen on more than one occassion! BIG HUG! terrible thing, and yea it is like a totall sense of lose of control terrible terrible! I hope I never have to go through that again! I wanted to run away from my self it was the most awful feeling, thankfully my go to guy allowed me to feel the feeling, go through it and come out the other side. My heart goes out to you anxiety, you are amazing person!

Posts.Title: Waiting For Biopsy - Just Feel So Low

Posts.Content:
Not feeling very strong today, in any aspect of the word/ Really struggling to keep on going. Not a good place to be in my head right now but it is what it is i guess. Had some teeth issues and now the dentist wants to remove them all from the top, onc said no way remove what you have to leave the rest what the hell?! then they say dont worry about
 the dentures till after treatment...um So i am going to bald, yes it s guaranteed because of one of the chemo drugs i have to take, and toothless, and tired, and sore, and 45 and already im asking my self is this worth it? Yea, sorry not very positive today, but this really is not a happy day, doesnt help that it is raining and im bleeding like there is no tomorow from my mouth, and all i wanted was a drink of water and then this happend. Ok will check back in later, hopefully I can come through this one too and be brighter tomorow. thanks for listenening thugh it does help. Hugs

Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Hey grammy =) uh yea it is really scary! When i think about
 my mammogram i don't think alarm bells started going of for me untill they ordered a biopsy immediatly, no ifs and or buts even the nurse was suprised since she asked the Dr."right now?" is what she said. When he said immediatly I think thats when I thought ok this is not good. So being told they want extra testing done sends off all kinds of alarm bells hey? I really did not think to much about
 it though till i got the confirmation of the results back, that is partly my hubby though as he is a born optimist and it tends to rub off on me too lol. more indepth mammogram do they mean they want to do an ultra sound? I wont be here wensday so will have to wait for your reply =( Let me know what happens grammy ok, im going to pray very hard for you and hope that it is a triumph and happy news.

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Title: having strange symptoms and need advice

Posts.Content:
Hey Deb, newly diagnosed with breast cancer. I been reading your posts every day for the last few days. It helps me to read post from other women who have gone through or are going through what i am about
 to step into the ring with. I cant relate to the infections and wounds as I have not had surgery yet, althugh i am scared. some of the things you said too i can relate to though, not being able to sleep for one, for different reasons, however lack of sleep or improper sleep can really take a toll on a person especially on us =(
Trying to wallow in self pity..don't confuse genuine greif with pity hun. It is very early for me and already i am painfully aware that we run a gambit of emotions some are not fun nice pretty or easy to deal with, but it is definatly not self pity! Self pity would be giving up and saying the hell with it what will be will be, you are obviously not giving up so feel what you feel ebrace it and know that feelings change for us like a cloudy day turns bright and visa versa sometimes through the course of a day we feel more than we felt in one day when we were not sick, or maybe we just more sensative to how we are feeling i don't knwo but i do know this I feel what I feel for a reason and no one should taketry to that away from me or anyone.
As for the last thing i have not had my right breast removed yet although i know it is inevitable as I have stage 4 cancer and im 45 years old, does that sound like self pity? lol, if it does that ok it make me mad, i had grand plans for my self and my husband, who just recently had a mild stoke. But if i put myself in your shoes, which is not to difficult for me to do, I can understand wanting to feel whole, and normal. Some will opt to have reconstructive surgery some will not. But the common thing we all have is that we do have to come to terms with the fact that we have breast cancer and it leaves scars. wanting to feel a sense of normalcy is totally ok you know, its not about
 impressing any one, its abut doing what is right for you. Breast Cancer im finding is a very personal thing, that we share with others who also are fighting to live, because with out support I don't think i could go it alone, but that does not change the fact that it is my body that has been invaded by cancer. i have no right to tell any one else how to fight their battle all i can do is sit on the side lines and cheer, comfort,cry, laugh, hope and pray with them for all of us, while i fight my fight, and hope that i have a cheering squad too lol =). How are you supposed to feel? you are supposed to Feel what ever you feel even if sometimes yu wish you could flick the switch to happy mode, we feel what we feel for a reason and it is not self pity hun. You know that silly song "Its my party and i'll cry if i want too, you would cry too if it happened to you!" that runs through my head a lot these days lol. Keep coming back hun here to listen and offer what comfort i can.
Hugs

AgeInfo.Phrase: stage 4 cancer and im 45 years old  does that sound

Posts.Title: Mastectomy complications

Posts.Content:
Dear Anxiety, it sounds like you are a bit like me in that I prepare for the worst and hope for the best lol it is ok =) It is normal to worry , it just becomes unhealthy for us when we are stuck in the worry part 24/7 and become paralized with fear and anxiety and it affects our quality of life. 
 For me I had to be aware of what my Brain wanted to process at any given time, as it constantly changes, as treatment changes and there are a lot of thngs to deal with. For me now I Have to come to terms and accept that ok lost some of my teeth so they could start chemo..that really sucked! Now I have to process ok they want to do heart test and chemo in the next two days. The thing is as difficult and heartbreaking some of the steps are I have to keep taking them if I want to give my self and my family a chance to have me in this world longer.
 I had to allow my self to feel those feeling acknowledge yea im scared outa my mind, or worried sick, or desperate for comfort what ever it is i was feeling and why i was feeling that way is ok. However, I only allowed myself to feel and prosses those thoughts in increments. Meaning I give my self permission to feel the feelings and acknowledge where they are coming from, accept that is how i feel and why, share with my closest and most trusted and become vunerable with them, then move on to some thing else, at least for a little while lol. If i have to go back to the dark place many times a day i do that, but i only stay for a little while, then move onto something else to give myself a break from my self lol =) A little while may mean something different to you than it does me that is ok , but all day and night is not a little while lol. 
 It is ok to be scared, and it is ok to cry, and it is ok to laugh, and it is ok to be vunerable, and it is ok to be you in any given moment.
Be Gentle with yourself, and not fret about
 having feelings, just allow your self to feel the not great feelings and acknowledge them know they are there, why they are there, then have the courage and faith to let them go even if for a little while. The day is comprised of moments, and every moment is going to be different, some great some definatly not so great, but each moment is a moment lived, and deserves to be recognized, but not horded cause if we hoard moments especially the bad ones we are going to miss some really spectacular and awsome moments =D you are stronger and more brave than you give yourself credit for you know, sharing with us your vunarbilty and fear takes a lot of courage and strength to reach out for help, it is ok you know.
Baby steps still get you were you need to be, so yea im taking baby steps, you can take baby steps with me too, it is ok .
Posts.Title: Waiting For Biopsy - Just Feel So Low

Posts.Content: You gals are awsome i really needed to hear your kind words! going for heart test tomorow and they plan to start chemo on wensday so will be off and running again. Slept a lot these past few days after teeth were out a lot of pain, not all of them he took 7 out although he wanted take them all and the cancer dr said no it is to much trama take the prioritys out so she does not have issues with infection during chemo. You girls are wonderfuly wonderful thank you for the words of encouragement and patiencee with me as i dont log in as much as i would like to, should be better now since they are healing and the pain is not near what it was =D HUGE HUGS for all of you they are freely given.
Posts.Title: Update

Posts.Content: ok s had the teeth removed and yup im in a lot of pain and still not in a place of being ok with it. The pain really does not help me be postive though.
Posts.Title: Update

Posts.Content:
Had a really good day! started treatment now on chemo, am very happy about
 that as i found two new lumps, so starting treatment was a big relief for me! But Today I am happy, and im gonna embrace that and bask in for all its woeth and believe me when i say it is worth a lot to me =D so glad to feel like myself today!! HUGS
Posts.Title: Update

Posts.Content:
Hey Grammy sorry it seems like a long time since i posted, but wanted to touch base with you, as i am off on another road trip on tuesday for more tests and education about
 my meds and stuff. Still have a few more tests to take on my heart and what not, but so far it looks pretty good. Will be taking chemo before surgery, then surgery, then radiation, so at least I have an idea what i have to be prepared for, to an extent any way. Still waiting for a couple more test results. My Dr, who looks after the chemo told me that I may feel like stopping the treatments, but she is going to do everything in her power to convince me not too. i looked at her and said im not here for a play date, and it seems neither are you lol, so just keep me honest about
 my disease and we will get along fine and i wont bonk you on the head even if there are times i reeeeaaaallly want too. She also told me unequivocally that I will lose my hair...I said give me my life and you can have the hair...
So grateful to have you ladies, to talk and share my journey with and walk with you on yours. Hugs
Posts.Title: CrammyGrammy

Posts.Content:
Hey Alexikins, so glad you are reaching out for support. I really am sorry that you are having troubles with your breasts, really this is not something I would wish on any one, it is devastating, to deal with a serious illness/disease. Honestly, you do not have to worry about
 what you do not know yet, it is hard to not worry about
 the what ifs, but if you can think about
 what you do know. i know it is really hard to do this, I am going for my first appointment with the specialists and cancer team tomorow, I know i have cancer, what I do not know is how bad is it, has it spread am i in really serious trouble, ect, there are some things I am pretty sure about
 by what my doctor said, that the fact that it is in my lymph nodes makes it serious, I just don't know how serious so I think about
 what I do know and try to come to terms with that. Yes I have cancer, yes it is in the lymph nodes, yes I need more information before I can come to terms with what I don't know =). the fact that my doctor talked to me sorry don't know how to spell it lol so will just say fake breasts, (forgive me if this offends anyone) tells me that a mastectomy is probable.. but you know what I did not get confirmation that this is indeed the case, so me being me I'm going to belive that it is possible this may not happen untill told other wise. this does not mean i do not have moments of doubt and fear, that would be a lie, cause I do, i think it is human nature to think contemplate the what ifs, but I try very hard not to think about
 them to often or to long because like i said untill I get the facts, it is just that a what if's. Please understand this is not the same as denial, because I am very aware I have breast cancer, and any cancer is a serious thing, what i don't do is tire my self out thinking about
 what ifs too much because I am pretty confident i am going to need all my energy to deal with what i do know =). I hope this helps Alix, and i do empathize with you and I do understand were you are coming from, and i do want you to share with us your fears, concerns and triumphs =). Just letting you know that the what if's are not your priority at the moment, your priority right now is you =) and that means being gentle with your self and not tiring your self out. Talking to others is really healthy and it helps keep the what ifs at bay. i wont be able to post tomorow but hopefully will be able to post again on thursday, please keep in touch and know that my prayers are with you, and if the what ifs creep up on you it is ok this is a way that we try to prepare our selves for possible out comes, but they are at this point just possibles, and we need to look at it that way hey =) Untill im told otherwise everything I can think of are just possibilities, and I am just going to deal with what I do know for today. If tommorows possibilities are better than my what IF's Cheers!!! If my Ifs are confirmed then I will deal with them too, but the ifs are not going to take up to much of my time as I hope they will nt take up to much of yours. I know it is a long wait, waiting can be brutal, but you do not have to wait alone.
Posts.Title: 23, Breast Masses and Scared

Posts.Content: Hi Momcate, I have just been recently diagnosed with Breast cancer. i develeped a mass in my breast, which they say is suggestive of carcinoma, and i developed a lump shortly after which is positve for lymph node metastasis. It is far better to go to the doctor and get it checked, mamagram, ultra sound and biopsy is what they did on me. It is scary as heck beleive me i know this, but that lump will weigh on your mind all the time untill you get confirmation negative or positve. In any event please go to the dr and get it checked. Please let me know how it goes for you.
Posts.Title: Change in breast

Posts.Content:
Ya i can understand your concern, i think though the fact that you found it so early and it is not very big is good thing though! You know your breast better than any one and if you find somethng like that the best thing to do is go Tell your Dr about
 the lump and how it is acting, like you shared with us. It very well could be nothing to be concerned about
 and what a relief that would be to hear that from your Dr, but if it something to investigate earlier is way better hun believe me. The last thing i want to do is scare you, I just am really concerned for you too. but the way you discribe it i am very optimistic too =) I really look forward to hearing from you again no matter what. hugs

Tammy 45 years old northern alberta, the terminology you all are using is new to me im sorry i have only got diagnosed on 21/04/2014 i can tell you all what my report says though even if i really not sure what it means other than I have a serious problem.
breast mass suggestive of invasive ductal carcinoma, lymph node biopsy positive for metastasis.
